Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior glazed (fired brown); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of feline (head and forelegs missing; added red on belly and rump) to left; incised splinter and blob rosettes and dots as filling ornament; below, three bands above tips of rays.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217, no. 10)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 94, no. A128)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.073) (Phase 1)
